messages: 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:06): when i create my canvas using CSS width and height, and make it taller than it is wide, my 50x50 rectangles come out very distorted
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:14): 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506, CSS width and height don't affect the actual canvas
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:16): you cant have perfect square if your canvas is not a perfect square
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:16): this seems like a trivial thing
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:17): You just need the width and height *attributes*
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:17): CSS only scales the canvas, but doesn't affect its coordinates
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:20): so if i make the canvas width and height 100% of the div?
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:20): it wasnt in a div.. should i place it in one and do that
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:29): but how can i place a border around my canvas, not the div
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:29): in order to make sure its filling properly
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:30): 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506: I suggest you do it with... CSS!

871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:31): NO! I want to use json, to send a requset to the server, and create a java backend, to querry the request, parse the data, concact a border, and stream the border back to the canvas, PIXELBYPIXELOK?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:32): ok it could be worse.... you could use PHP backend! :)
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:34): so you think json / java is a good choice for backend for a game?
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:34): im still a bit unclear how it all works, but just to steer me in the right direction
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:34): 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506: I don't see how JSON is relatd to the programming language
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:35): 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506: but you need something like http://socket.io for full-duplex communications
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:35): ok so i wont need json...
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:37): 871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506: it is abstraction library which will fall back to HTTP polling if websocket support is not found
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (22:41): any idea why im getting unnecssary extra white border when u scroll down here?
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:06): can anyone tell me why my site has extra white space when you make the browser window smaller and scroll down
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:24): how do i make li elemnts fill 100% of the ul, so they auto space themselves
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:24): click here, and adjust the result window so it is skinny like a phone to see what i mean
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:25): You want [[   ][   ][   ][   ][   ][   ]], and have that fill the entire width of a box, without knowing in advance how many li's you have?
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:26): exactly 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 but, i don know exactly how many li i have in advance
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:26): Then you can just use width: 20%
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:26): but, when i add a border, it kills it
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:27): will the table method still work?
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:27): ehh id rather try to be a bit more precies
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:27): outline might work, but then you get borders on all sides
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:28): i dont get how outline would hlep
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (23:29): outline does not add to the width
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:29): that is like a fricken border: inside
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:30): is there any reason i shouldnt use outline?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (23:30): there is no way to do outline on one side
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:31): it doesnt seem to be a problem for me, check it out
871a5c51b4a748ece6483e5f77671506 (23:31): it looks like its only 1px between each
991eeb6f14101aa1373dbb04fd51b329 (23:39): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e, fyi I managed to get it working by taking the inline svg elements and use that as base64 encoded in an image data uri
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:39): 991eeb6f14101aa1373dbb04fd51b329: I don't know what the question was, but I'm interested in the answer...

991eeb6f14101aa1373dbb04fd51b329 (23:41): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, i have a html5 page with inline svg elements, but those didn't render in opera... since 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e is an opera magician I consulted her and wanted to let her know I had come up with a solution
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:44): 991eeb6f14101aa1373dbb04fd51b329: I'd appreciate if you could make a simple example to explain what you did, maybe in a blog post
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:45): I'd be happy to retweet that from the SVG WG twitter account

4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:47): d3 is so hot right now
991eeb6f14101aa1373dbb04fd51b329 (23:48): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, sweet && thx and will let you know when i've something to show
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:50): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: actually, no, I think I need to
53e9c7f51ef86a3ed2577bd23d27cdf1 (23:51): Quick question. I have a 40x40px image on a canvas. But why is the image getting streched? http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8183146/temp/warcraft_html5/test.html
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:52): your canvas needs height/width attrs on it
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (23:53): 53e9c7f51ef86a3ed2577bd23d27cdf1: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Canvas_tutorial/Using_images you need to specify output width/height afaik
53e9c7f51ef86a3ed2577bd23d27cdf1 (23:53): oh, the css streches the canvas
